title: This Lip Liner Is Unlike Anything I’ve Tried Before
description: In a sea of new makeup launches, Merit’s lip liner holds its own.
excerpt: In a sea of new makeup launches, Merit’s lip liner holds its own.
text: I once dreamt of attending art school and becoming a painter, but unfortunately, that didn’t happen. These days, the closest I get to drawing or painting is when I pencil in my nonexistent eyebrows or slightly overline my lips—tiny, temporary sketches I wash off every evening. However, I’m particular about the tools I use, and as a beauty writer, I test so many formulas that I never apply a makeup product more than once unless it’s actually good. One launch that I’ve picked up not once, not twice, but too many times to count in the last month is the new Merit Signature Lip Sheer Lip Liner.I can confidently say I’ve never tried a lip liner quite like this one. If you’ve used Merit’s Flush Balm Cream Blush, you’re probably familiar with its sheer, gel-like quality. Merit basically cooked up a lip liner equivalent. When you first apply it, you might be shocked at how easily it glides on and how shiny the finish is until it settles into a soft matte; it feels more like a satin lipstick rather than a traditional lip liner. “It has a weightless, airy feel when applied, almost as if you’re not wearing anything at all. I particularly love its creamy texture, which glides on smoothly (but not too much) when you press your lips for an ombre effect,” adds Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com’s beauty commerce editor. Because of the sheer and buildable nature of the formula, I can scribble the pencil around the perimeter of my lips repeatedly without being too precious about it. Safe to say, it pretty much blends itself and creates just the right amount of definition. There’s no need for precision (although the retractable pencil does come with a sharpener at the end). Also, this lip liner won’t suck the moisture out of your lips or emphasize wrinkles like other longwear lip liners might, thanks to nourishing ingredients like pomegranate flower extract and jojoba oil. I prefer to wear it all over my lips instead of just on the edges, and I always get compliments left and right. A typical drawback of any hydrating formula is that it might not last as long, but I found that once the lip liner set down, it could last throughout an average day as long as I didn’t eat any messy or greasy meals. Courtesy of Carol LeeAssociate beauty e-commerce writer Carol Lee wearing Merit’s Signature Lip Sheer Lip Liner in Bespoke.The liner comes in eight ultra-neutral shades: Beverly Hills (soft peach), Sportif (warm peach), Coupé (cool pink), Mayfair (cool mauve), Bespoke (pink brown), Tabac (neutral brown), Brownstone (warm brown), and Capricorn (rich brown). As a brown lip obsessive, my favorite is undoubtedly Bespoke, which I sometimes pair with the Merit Signature Lip Lightweight Satin Lipstick in Bespoke (a limited-edition product from last year’s holiday lipstick gift set that needs to become permanent, please). However, I should note that the deeper shades may be too sheer to fully show up on deeper skin tones. “My one qualm is the color payoff,” says Penrose. “The dark brown shades aren’t deep enough for a noticeable outline on me, but they do provide a subtle chestnut brown guard to enhance my lip glosses and lipstick combos.” That being said, if you find typical lip liners too drying, too pigmented, and too messy, Merit’s new Signature Lip Sheer Lip Liner may be the foolproof answer to your prayers. I’m certainly happy that it’s in my life, and celebrities like Tracee Ellis Ross, Ayo Edebiri, and Aimee Lou Wood have already stepped out wearing it. The product officially launches on March 18, but if you’re chomping at the bit to try the formula, here’s an exciting little secret: Starting today, Merit is giving ELLE readers two full days of early access on meritbeauty.com. Merit Signature Lip Sheer Lip Liner
html:
I once dreamt of attending art school and becoming a painter, but unfortunately, that didn’t happen. These days, the closest I get to drawing or painting is when I pencil in my nonexistent eyebrows or slightly overline my lips—tiny, temporary sketches I wash off every evening. However, I’m particular about the tools I use, and as a beauty writer, I test so many formulas that I never apply a makeup product more than once unless it’s actually good. One launch that I’ve picked up not once, not twice, but too many times to count in the last month is the new Merit Signature Lip Sheer Lip Liner.

I can confidently say I’ve never tried a lip liner quite like this one. If you’ve used Merit’s Flush Balm Cream Blush, you’re probably familiar with its sheer, gel-like quality. Merit basically cooked up a lip liner equivalent. When you first apply it, you might be shocked at how easily it glides on and how shiny the finish is until it settles into a soft matte; it feels more like a satin lipstick rather than a traditional lip liner. “It has a weightless, airy feel when applied, almost as if you’re not wearing anything at all. I particularly love its creamy texture, which glides on smoothly (but not too much) when you press your lips for an ombre effect,” adds Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com’s beauty commerce editor.

Because of the sheer and buildable nature of the formula, I can scribble the pencil around the perimeter of my lips repeatedly without being too precious about it. Safe to say, it pretty much blends itself and creates just the right amount of definition. There’s no need for precision (although the retractable pencil does come with a sharpener at the end). Also, this lip liner won’t suck the moisture out of your lips or emphasize wrinkles like other longwear lip liners might, thanks to nourishing ingredients like pomegranate flower extract and jojoba oil. I prefer to wear it all over my lips instead of just on the edges, and I always get compliments left and right. A typical drawback of any hydrating formula is that it might not last as long, but I found that once the lip liner set down, it could last throughout an average day as long as I didn’t eat any messy or greasy meals.

Associate beauty e-commerce writer Carol Lee wearing Merit’s Signature Lip Sheer Lip Liner in Bespoke.

The liner comes in eight ultra-neutral shades: Beverly Hills (soft peach), Sportif (warm peach), Coupé (cool pink), Mayfair (cool mauve), Bespoke (pink brown), Tabac (neutral brown), Brownstone (warm brown), and Capricorn (rich brown). As a brown lip obsessive, my favorite is undoubtedly Bespoke, which I sometimes pair with the Merit Signature Lip Lightweight Satin Lipstick in Bespoke (a limited-edition product from last year’s holiday lipstick gift set that needs to become permanent, please). However, I should note that the deeper shades may be too sheer to fully show up on deeper skin tones. “My one qualm is the color payoff,” says Penrose. “The dark brown shades aren’t deep enough for a noticeable outline on me, but they do provide a subtle chestnut brown guard to enhance my lip glosses and lipstick combos.”

That being said, if you find typical lip liners too drying, too pigmented, and too messy, Merit’s new Signature Lip Sheer Lip Liner may be the foolproof answer to your prayers. I’m certainly happy that it’s in my life, and celebrities like Tracee Ellis Ross, Ayo Edebiri, and Aimee Lou Wood have already stepped out wearing it. The product officially launches on March 18, but if you’re chomping at the bit to try the formula, here’s an exciting little secret: Starting today, Merit is giving ELLE readers two full days of early access on meritbeauty.com.

Merit Signature Lip Sheer Lip Liner
